docblock.description: Database and template file access for MLA needs
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) Data provides database and template file access for MLA needs
docblock.long-description: The _template functions are inspired by the book "WordPress 3 Plugin Development Essentials." Templates separate HTML markup from PHP code for easier maintenance and localization.

docblock.description: WP_Query filter "parameters"
docblock.long-description: This array defines parameters for the query's join, where and orderby filters. The parameters are set up in the _prepare_list_table_query function, and any further logic required to translate those values is contained in the filters.

docblock.description: Initialization function, similar to __construct()
Load an HTML template from a file
docblock.long-description: Loads a template to a string or a multi-part template to an array. Multi-part templates are divided by comments of the form , where "key" becomes the key part of the array.

tag.name: param
tag.description: Complete path and name of the template file

tag.name: return
tag.description: string for files that do not contain template divider comments, array for files containing template divider comments, false if file does not exist, NULL if file could not be loaded.

docblock.description: Expand a template, replacing place holders with their values
docblock.long-description: A simple parsing function for basic templating.

tag.name: param
tag.description: An associative array containing keys and values e.g. array('key' => 'value')

tag.name: return
tag.description: Placeholders corresponding to the keys of the hash will be replaced with their values

docblock.description: Get the total number of attachment posts
Retrieve attachment objects for list table display
docblock.long-description: Supports prepare_items in class-mla-list-table.php. Modeled after wp_edit_attachments_query in wp-admin/post.php

tag.name: param
tag.description: query parameters from web page, usually found in $_REQUEST

tag.name: param
tag.description: number of rows to skip over to reach desired page

tag.name: param
tag.description: number of rows on each page

tag.name: return
tag.description: attachment objects (posts) including parent data, meta data and references

docblock.description: Sanitize and expand query arguments from request variables
docblock.long-description: Prepare the arguments for WP_Query. Modeled after wp_edit_attachments_query in wp-admin/post.php

tag.name: param
tag.description: query parameters from web page, usually found in $_REQUEST

docblock.description: Add filters, run query, remove filters

tag.name: param
tag.description: query parameters from web page, usually found in $_REQUEST

docblock.description: Adds a JOIN clause, if required
docblock.long-description: Defined as public because it's a filter.

docblock.description: Adds a WHERE clause for detached items
docblock.long-description: Modeled after _edit_attachments_query_helper in wp-admin/post.php. Defined as public because it's a filter.

docblock.description: Adds a ORDERBY clause, if required
docblock.long-description: Expands the range of sort options because the logic in WP_Query is limited. Defined as public because it's a filter.

docblock.description: Retrieve an Attachment array given a $post_id
docblock.long-description: The (associative) array will contain every field that can be found in the posts and postmeta tables, and all references to the attachment.

tag.name: param
tag.description: The ID of the attachment post

tag.name: return
tag.description: NULL on failure else associative array

docblock.description: Find Featured Image and inserted image/link references to an attachment
docblock.long-description: Searches all post and page content to see if the attachment is used as a Featured Image or inserted in the post as an image or link.

tag.name: param
tag.description: post ID of attachment's parent, if any

docblock.description: Returns information about an attachment's parent, if found

tag.name: param
tag.description: post ID of attachment's parent, if any

tag.name: return
tag.description: Parent information; post_date, post_title and post_type

docblock.description: Fetch and filter meta data for an attachment
docblock.long-description: Returns a filtered array of a post's meta data. Internal values beginning with '' are stripped out or converted to an 'mla' equivalent. Array data is replaced with a string containing the first array element.

docblock.description: Media Library Assistant extended List Table class
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) List Table implements the "Assistant" admin submenu
docblock.long-description: Extends the core WP_List_Table class.

docblock.description: Records assignment of row-level actions to a table row
docblock.long-description: Set to the current Post-ID when row-level actions are output for the row.

docblock.description: Currently hidden columns
docblock.long-description: Records hidden columns so row-level actions are not assigned to them.

property.name: $default_columns
property.default: array('cb' => '<input type="checkbox" />', 'icon' => '', 'ID_parent' => 'ID/Parent', 'title_name' => 'Title/Name', 'post_title' => 'Title', 'post_name' => 'Name', 'parent' => 'Parent ID', 'featured' => 'Featured in', 'inserted' => 'Inserted in', 'alt_text' => 'ALT Text', 'caption' => 'Caption', 'description' => 'Description', 'post_mime_type' => 'MIME Type', 'base_file' => 'Base File', 'date' => 'Date', 'modified' => 'Last Modified', 'author' => 'Author', 'attached_to' => 'Attached to')

docblock.description: Table column definitions
docblock.long-description:
This array defines table columns and titles where the key is the column slug (and class) and the value is the column's title text. If you need a checkbox for bulk actions, use the special slug "cb".

The 'cb' column is treated differently than the rest. If including a checkbox column in your table you must create a column_cb() method. If you don't need bulk actions or checkboxes, simply leave the 'cb' entry out of your array.

Taxonomy columns are added to this array by mla_admin_init_action.

docblock.description: Default values for hidden columns
docblock.long-description:
This array is used when the user-level option is not set, i.e., the user has not altered the selection of hidden columns.

The value on the right-hand side must match the column slug, e.g., array(0 => 'ID_parent, 1 => 'title_name').

Taxonomy columns are added to this array by mla_admin_init_action.

property.name: $default_sortable_columns
property.default: array('ID_parent' => array('ID', false), 'title_name' => array('title_name', false), 'post_title' => array('post_title', false), 'post_name' => array('post_name', false), 'parent' => array('post_parent', false), 'caption' => array('post_excerpt', false), 'description' => array('post_content', false), 'post_mime_type' => array('post_mime_type', false), 'base_file' => array('_wp_attached_file', false), 'date' => array('post_date', false), 'modified' => array('post_modified', false), 'author' => array('post_author', false), 'attached_to' => array('post_parent', false))

docblock.description: Sortable column definitions
docblock.long-description:
This array defines the table columns that can be sorted. The array key is the column slug that needs to be sortable, and the value is database column to sort by. Often, the key and value will be the same, but this is not always the case (as the value is a column name from the database, not the list table).

The array value also contains a boolean which is 'true' if the data is currently sorted by that column. This is computed each time the table is displayed.

docblock.description: Access the default list of hidden columns
Return the names and display values of the sortable columns

tag.name: return
tag.description: name => array( orderby value, heading ) for sortable columns

docblock.description: Handler for filter 'get_user_option_managemedia_page_mla-menucolumnshidden'
docblock.long-description: Required because the screen.php get_hidden_columns function only uses the get_user_option result. Set when the file is loaded because the object is not created in time for the call from screen.php.

tag.name: param
tag.description: current list of hidden columns, if any

docblock.description: Handler for filter 'manage_media_page_mla-menu_columns'
docblock.long-description: This required filter dictates the table's columns and titles. Set when the file is loaded because the list_table object isn't created in time to affect the "screen options" setup.

docblock.long-description: Called in the admin_init action because the list_table object isn't created in time to affect the "screen options" setup.

docblock.description: Initializes some properties from $_REQUEST vairables, then calls the parent constructor to set some default configs.

docblock.long-description: Called when the parent class can't find a method specifically built for a given column. The taxonomy columns are handled here. All other columns should have a specific method, so this function returns a troubleshooting message.

docblock.description: Prepares the list of items for displaying
docblock.long-description: This is where you prepare your data for display. This method will usually be used to query the database, sort and filter the data, and generally get it ready to be displayed. At a minimum, we should set $this->items and $this->set_pagination_args().

docblock.description: Top-level functions for the Media Library Assistant
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) provides several enhancements to the handling of images and files held in the WordPress Media Library.

docblock.long-description: The custom taxonomy add/edit submenu entries go to "upload.php" by default. This filter is the only way to redirect them to the correct WordPress page.

docblock.description: Manages the plugin option settings and provides the settings page to edit them
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) Settings manages the plugin option settings and provides the settings page to edit them.
Provides a unique name for the settings page
Provides a unique name for the current version option

property.name: $mla_options
property.default:
array(self::MLA_VERSION_OPTION => array('type' => 'hidden', 'std' => '0'), 'attachment_category' => array('name' => 'Attachment Categories', 'type' => 'hidden', 'std' => 'checked', 'help' => 'Check this option to add support for Attachment Categories.'), 'attachment_tag' => array('name' => 'Attachment Tags', 'type' => 'hidden', 'std' => 'checked', 'help' => 'Check this option to add support for Attachment Tags.'), 'taxonomy_heading' => array('name' => 'Taxonomy Support', 'type' => 'header'), 'taxonomy_support' => array('help' => 'Check the "Support" box to add the taxonomy to the Assistant.
Check the "Quick Edit" box to display the taxonomy in the Quick Edit panel.
Use the "List Filter" option to select the taxonomy on which to filter the Assistant table listing.', 'std' => array('tax_support' => array('attachment_category' => 'checked', 'attachment_tag' => 'checked'), 'tax_quick_edit' => array('attachment_category' => 'checked', 'attachment_tag' => 'checked'), 'tax_filter' => 'attachment_category'), 'type' => 'custom', 'render' => '_taxonomy_handler', 'update' => '_taxonomy_handler', 'delete' => '_taxonomy_handler', 'reset' => '_taxonomy_handler'), 'orderby_heading' => array('name' => 'Default Table Listing Sort Order', 'type' => 'header'), 'default_orderby' => array('name' => 'Order By', 'type' => 'select', 'std' => 'Title/Name', 'options' => array('Title/Name'), 'texts' => array('Title/Name'), 'help' => 'Select the column for the sort order of the Assistant table listing.'), 'default_order' => array('name' => 'Order', 'type' => 'radio', 'std' => 'ASC', 'options' => array('ASC', 'DESC'), 'texts' => array('Ascending', 'Descending'), 'help' => 'Choose the sort order.'))

docblock.description: $mla_options defines the database options and admin page areas for setting/updating them.
docblock.long-description:
Each option is defined by an array with the following elements:

array key => HTML id/name attribute and option database key (OMIT MLA_OPTION_PREFIX)

name => admin page label or heading text type => 'checkbox', 'header', 'radio', 'select', 'text', 'textarea', 'custom', 'hidden' std => default value help => help text size => text size, default 40 cols => textbox columns, default 90 rows => textbox rows, default 5 options => array of radio or select option values texts => array of radio or select option display texts render => rendering function for 'custom' options. Usage: $options_list .= ['render']( 'render', $key, $value, $page_template_array ); update => update function for 'custom' options; returns nothing. Usage: $message = ['update']( 'update', $key, $value, $_REQUEST ); delete => delete function for 'custom' options; returns nothing. Usage: $message = ['delete']( 'delete', $key, $value, $_REQUEST ); reset => reset function for 'custom' options; returns nothing. Usage: $message = ['reset']( 'reset', $key, $value, $_REQUEST );

docblock.description: Media Library Assistant Plugin Loader
docblock.long-description: Defines constants and loads all of the classes and functions required to run the plugin. This file is only loaded if the naming conflict tests in index.php are passed.

docblock.description: Gives a unique prefix for plugin options; can be set in wp-config.php
Provides several enhancements to the handling of images and files held in the WordPress Media Library
docblock.long-description: This file contains several tests for name conflicts with other plugins. Only if the tests are passed will the rest of the plugin be loaded and run.

docblock.description: Provides path information to the plugin root in file system format.
Provides path information to the plugin root in URL format.
Displays name conflict error messages at the top of the Dashboard
Provides basic run-time tests to ensure the plugin can run in the current WordPress envrionment
Class MLA (Media Library Assistant) Test provides basic run-time tests to ensure the plugin can run in the current WordPress envrionment.
Test that your PHP version is at least that of the $min_php_version

tag.name: param
tag.description: representing the minimum required version of PHP, e.g. '5.3.2'

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the plugin for messaging purposes

tag.name: return
tag.description: Exit with messaging if PHP version is too old

docblock.description: Test that your WordPress version is at least that of the $min_version

tag.name: param
tag.description: representing the minimum required version of WordPress, e.g. '3.3.0'

tag.name: param
tag.description: Name of the plugin for messaging purposes

tag.name: return
tag.description: Exit with messaging if version is too old
